category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 31 (Convocation of Board of Directors)
contents: Article 31 (Convocation of the Board of Directors) ① The Chairman convenes the Board of Directors and becomes the chairman. ② The Board of Directors is divided into regular and extraordinary meetings. ③ The regular meetings are convened in February and October each year, and the extraordinary meetings are held as follows: A meeting shall be convened in any of the following cases: 1. When the Chairman deems it necessary; 2. When more than 1/3 of the registered directors request a meeting in writing specifying the purpose of the meeting; ④ Convocation in accordance with the provisions of Paragraph 3, Item 2 When a request is made, the Chairman of the Board of Directors must convene a Board of Directors meeting within 7 days from the date of the request. ⑤ When convening a Board of Directors meeting, each member must be notified of the intention at least 7 days prior to the convening. However, exceptions may be made in cases of emergency or unavoidable circumstances.
